required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of ASN003 in Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open-label, Dose-finding and Cohort Expansion Study of ASN003 in Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock:
The study is divided into two parts. The first part of the study will test various doses of ASN003 to find out the highest safe dose to test in three specific groups.
The second part of the study will test how well ASN003 can control cancer. Subjects will be enrolled into one of three groups.
Group 1: metastatic or recurrent melanoma with documented BRAFV600 mutation (n=20 evaluable patients) Group 2: metastatic colorectal cancer (CRC), or advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with documented BRAFV600 mutation (n=14 evaluable patients) Group 3: advanced solid tumors with documented PI3K pathway alterations (PIK3CA mutation or PTEN loss) (n=14 evaluable patients)

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will be conducted in two parts. Part A is a dose escalation study to determine a safe and tolerable dose of ASN003 for subjects with advanced solid tumors. Part A will also characterize the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of ASN003 through blood sampling and optional biopsies.. Part B will only enroll subjects in three groups:
Group 1: subjects who have metastatic or recurrent melanoma with the BRAFv600 mutation.
Group 2: subjects who have advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer, or colorectal cancer with the BRAFv600 mutation.
Group 3: subjects who have advanced or metastatic cancers with phosphatidylinositide 3-kinases (PI3K) mutations, or phosphatase and tensin homolog (PTEN) loss mutation. Subjects will be treated with the highest safe and tolerable dose determined in Part A of the study to determine preliminary efficacy. Subjects may continue to receive ASN003 for up to 1 year in the absence of severe side effects or disease progression.

primary_outcome.measure: Part A: Determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of ASN003
primary_outcome.description: The MTD will be determined by evaluating the number of subjects with treatment related dose limiting toxicity. This is the primary endpoint of Part A

primary_outcome.measure: Part B: evaluates the preliminary efficacy of ASN003 in subjects with selected BRAF and PI3 kinase mutated cancers
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the overall disease status using the RECIST 1.1 terms of complete response, partial response, stable disease, and progressive disease. This is the primary endpoint for Part B

secondary_outcome.measure: Calculate the Pharmacokinetic Area Under the Curve
secondary_outcome.description: A plot of the concentration of ASN003 in blood plasma over time.
The peak plasma concentration of ASN003
The time required for ASN003 to lose half of its pharmacologic activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in pharmacodynamic biomarkers
secondary_outcome.description: Pre-dose and post-dose pharmacodynamic biomarkers in plasma and tumor biopsy will be compared to assess signs of pharmacodynamic activity

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the size of measurable tumor lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the sum of the longest dimension in centimeters of each measurable lesion, the presence/absence of lesions that cannot be measured in centimeters, or the presence of new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the status of non-measurable tumor lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects that have resolution of non-measurable tumor lesions.
Number of subjects with new lesions

other_outcome.description: Tumor biopsy samples will be tested to look for changes

arm_group.description: Multiple ascending doses of ASN003 will be administered to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD).
ASN003 administered at the MTD in subjects with BRAF v600 mutated metastatic melanoma

arm_group.arm_group_label: ASN003 MTD - BRAFv600 colon or lung cancer
arm_group.description: ASN003 administered at the MTD in subjects with BRAFv600 mutated metastatic colorectal or non-small cell lung cancer.

arm_group.arm_group_label: ASN003 MTD - PIK3 pathway mutated cancers
arm_group.description: ASN003 administered at the MTD in subjects who have mutations in PI3 kinase or loss of PTEN.

intervention.description: The highest safe and well tolerated dose selected from the doses tested in Part A of the study.
intervention.arm_group_label: ASN003 MTD - BRAFv600 colon or lung cancer
ASN003 MTD - PIK3 pathway mutated cancers
